title: Will Brazil's data protection authority allow Meta to use Brazilian data for AI training by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Brazil's national data protection authority officially permits Meta (parent company of Facebook and Instagram) to use data originating from Brazil for training its artificial intelligence models. The permission must be confirmed through official statements from the Brazilian data protection authority or reports from at least two reputable international news sources. If no such permission is granted by the resolution date, or if the existing ban remains in place, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is specifically about the use of Brazilian data for AI training purposes, not general data collection or use.

title: Will Eli Lilly's new Alzheimer's drug be prescribed to more than 10,000 patients by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Eli Lilly's newly FDA-approved Alzheimer's drug (as of October 2023) is confirmed to have been prescribed to more than 10,000 patients in the United States. The number of prescriptions must be verified by official reports from Eli Lilly, reputable medical sources, or government health agencies. If the number of prescriptions is not confirmed to exceed 10,000 by the resolution date, or if official data is not available, the question resolves as NO. The drug in question is the one approved by the FDA for modestly slowing the progression of Alzheimer's disease.

title: Will the FDA issue additional warnings for Eli Lilly's newly approved Alzheimer's drug by July 2024?
body:
This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) issues any additional warnings or advisories specifically regarding Eli Lilly's newly approved Alzheimer's drug (as of October 2023). To qualify:

1. The warnings or advisories must be officially announced by the FDA.
2. They must be directly related to the safety, efficacy, or side effects of the drug.
3. The warnings must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal).

The question resolves as NO if no such warnings or advisories are issued by the FDA before July 31, 2024, or if the only communications from the FDA about the drug during this period are standard updates or clarifications that do not constitute new warnings.

title: Will Eli Lilly's newly approved Alzheimer's drug remain on the market through July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Eli Lilly's recently approved Alzheimer's drug (donanemab) remains available on the market through July 31, 2024. The drug must not be officially withdrawn from the market, either voluntarily by Eli Lilly or mandated by a regulatory body such as the FDA, during this period. An official withdrawal would be confirmed through company announcements or regulatory statements, and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the drug is withdrawn from the market for any reason before July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Eli Lilly's new Alzheimer's drug receive regulatory approval outside the US by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Eli Lilly's Alzheimer's drug (donanemab) receives regulatory approval for use in at least one country outside of the United States. The approval must be confirmed by the relevant regulatory body of the country and reported by at least two reputable international news sources. Reputable news sources include, but are not limited to, Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or major national news outlets. If no additional approvals are granted by the resolution date, or if the only approval remains from the US FDA, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is specifically about regulatory approval and not about the drug's availability or use in other countries.

The article must focus on the drug's efficacy, safety, or clinical trial results. The publication must be confirmed by the journal's official website and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such article is published by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note: The drug's FDA approval status is not relevant to this question's resolution.

title: Will there be a legal challenge to the HHS directive on emergency abortions by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there is a legal challenge filed against the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) directive stating that emergency room doctors must perform emergency abortions when necessary to save a pregnant woman's health. The legal challenge must be confirmed by official court filings or reported by at least two reputable news sources such as The Associated Press, Reuters, or The New York Times. If no such legal challenge is filed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note: This question is based on the situation as of October 1, 2023, and does not take into account any potential changes or developments after this date.

For the purpose of this question, 'federal directive' refers to guidance issued by a U.S. federal agency regarding emergency medical care practices.

The directive in question was issued in response to a Supreme Court ruling. A significant change would be an official announcement from the administration that alters the substance of the directive, such as changing the circumstances under which emergency abortions are required or permitted. The absence of change must be verifiable through official government statements or the lack thereof, and consistent reporting from at least two major news outlets. If a significant change is announced or implemented before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will Google report significant progress towards its net zero carbon emissions goal by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google officially announces significant progress towards its goal of achieving net zero carbon emissions by 2030. 'Significant progress' is defined as a reduction in carbon emissions of at least 20% compared to their 2023 levels, or the implementation of major initiatives that are projected to lead to such a reduction. The announcement must be made through Google's official channels (such as their annual Environmental Report or a press release) and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If Google does not report such progress by the specified date, or if they report an increase in emissions, the question resolves as NO.

title: Will the U.S. government initiate a significant payment to Moderna for pandemic vaccine development by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there is confirmation that the U.S. government has initiated a payment of $100 million or more to Moderna specifically for the development of a pandemic vaccine. Confirmation must come from official statements by Moderna, the U.S. government, or be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). The payment must be explicitly linked to pandemic vaccine development. If no such confirmation is available by the resolution date, or if the confirmed payment is less than $100 million, the question resolves as NO.

body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports of bird flu cases in dairy cows within the United States. The reports must specifically identify cases of avian influenza (bird flu) in dairy cows, not just suspected cases or cases in other livestock. If no such confirmed cases are reported by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the total damages awarded to plaintiffs in a high-profile lawsuit related to a controversial 2017 rally exceed $30 million, including any additional court rulings or settlements. The total amount must be confirmed by official court documents or at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). If the total does not exceed $30 million by the resolution date, or if there is insufficient reliable information to determine the total, the question resolves as NO. The initial damages awarded were reported to be over $26 million, but this amount may change due to appeals or additional rulings.

title: Will the legal challenge against the Biden administration's pause on gas export project approvals be resolved by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there is a final court decision on the legal challenge by 16 states against the Biden administration's pause on approving new liquefied natural gas (LNG) export projects. The resolution must be confirmed through official court rulings or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). A 'final court decision' means a ruling that either upholds or overturns the administration's pause, without the possibility of further appeals within the given timeframe. If the legal challenge remains unresolved, is still pending, or if appeals are still possible by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. Note that temporary or preliminary injunctions do not constitute a final resolution for this question.

body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, U.S. District Judge James Cain, Jr.'s ruling that the Biden administration cannot delay consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects is overturned by a higher court. The ruling in question was issued on October 1, 2023, or earlier. The overturning must be officially confirmed through court documents or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If the ruling remains in effect or is not overturned by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, 'overturned' means that a higher court has reversed, vacated, or significantly modified Judge Cain's ruling in a way that allows the Biden administration to delay consideration of these projects.

Reputable news sources include, but are not limited to, major financial news outlets, national newspapers, or established business news websites. If the company remains under Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection, fails to exit bankruptcy, or if no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. The resolution is based on publicly available information as of the resolution date.

title: Will Colorado hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Colorado holds a statewide referendum on enshrining protection for abortion rights in its state constitution by July 31, 2024. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially scheduled and conducted by the state government of Colorado, with the explicit purpose of deciding on constitutional protections for abortion rights. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government sources or at least two reputable national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or officially scheduled by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. Note that merely proposing or discussing a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual vote must take place or be officially scheduled within the specified timeframe.

title: Will Florida hold a referendum on abortion rights protection by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if Florida holds a statewide referendum on enshrining protection for abortion rights in its constitution, with the vote taking place on or before July 31, 2024. For a YES resolution: 1. The referendum must be officially scheduled and conducted by the state of Florida. 2. The proposed measure must specifically address the protection of abortion rights in the state constitution. 3. The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Florida. Official confirmation must come from Florida's government (e.g., Secretary of State's office) or be reported by at least two major national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The question resolves as NO if: 1. No such referendum is held by July 31, 2024, or 2. A scheduled referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, or 3. The referendum held does not specifically address constitutional protection for abortion rights. Note: The mere proposal or discussion of such a referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual vote must take place within the specified timeframe.

title: Will the EU take additional regulatory actions against Meta's ad-free option by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the European Union (EU) takes any additional regulatory actions against Meta Platforms specifically related to its ad-free option for Facebook and Instagram. Regulatory actions include, but are not limited to, fines, sanctions, or legal mandates. To qualify, these actions must be: 1. Officially announced by an EU regulatory body. 2. Directly related to Meta's ad-free subscription option for Facebook and Instagram. 3. Reported by at least two reputable international news sources. The question resolves as NO if no such additional regulatory actions are taken by the EU against Meta regarding this specific issue by July 31, 2024. Note: This question is based on the ongoing situation as of October 1, 2023, where the EU has accused Meta of breaching digital competition rules with its ad-free option.

title: Will any regulatory bodies block Boeing's proposed acquisition of Spirit AeroSystems by July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if any regulatory bodies (such as antitrust authorities or government agencies) officially block or reject the proposed acquisition of Spirit AeroSystems by Boeing before July 31, 2024. The blocking or rejection must be confirmed through official announcements from the regulatory body itself or reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, Financial Times). If no regulatory bodies block or reject the acquisition by this date, or if the acquisition is approved or completed, the question resolves as NO. Note that a delay in the approval process or a request for additional information does not constitute a block or rejection.
